SubTopics: Identify arithmetic patterns and explain the patterns using properties of operations.
Content: A pattern is shown.
What is the rule for the pattern?

Topics: Number Sense & Operations In Base Ten
SubTopics: Read, write and identify whole numbers within 100,000 using base ten numerals, number names and expanded form.
Content: There are 34,098 fans at the baseball stadium. What is the number name for the fans at the baseball stadium?

SubTopics: Solve one- and two-step problems using information presented in bar and/or picture graphs.
Content: Wesley goes bird watching each day for four days. He makes a picture graph to show how many birds he sees on each day.
problems/MOG3M/media/3a.jpg
How many more birds did Wesley see on Wednesday than on Monday?

SubTopics: Use the four operations to solve problems involving lengths, liquid volumes or weights given in the same units.
Content: A swimming pool has 245 gallons of water in it. A hose is used to add 330 more gallons of water to the swimming pool. How many gallons of water are in the swimming pool now?

SubTopics: Interpret the reasonableness of answers using mental computation and estimation strategies including rounding.
Content: Donny is saving money to buy a skateboard that costs $28. He has saved $11 so far. Donny rounds each of these numbers to the nearest ten to estimate how much more money he needs to save. He estimates that he needs to save $10 more to buy the skateboard. Donny made a mistake. Which statement most likely explains the mistake Donny made while estimating?

A.Choice: He subtracted and then rounded incorrectly.

B.Choice: He rounded the greater number down instead of up.

C.Choice: He rounded the greater number up instead of down.

D.Choice: He forgot to regroup when he was subtracting the two amounts.

Topics: Number Sense & Operations In Base Ten
SubTopics: Round whole numbers to the nearest 10 or 100.
Content: The organizer of a marathon purchased 654 bottles of water for the runners to drink. Select the ùóßùó™ùó¢ numbers that represent either the number of bottles rounded to the nearest ten or the number of bottles rounded to the nearest hundred.

SubTopics: Create frequency tables, scaled picture graphs and bar graphs to represent a data set with several categories.
Content: Kate counts the number of dogs she sees at a dog park each day for 5 days. She makes the table to show how many dogs she sees.
problems/MOG3M/media/7a.jpg
Make a bar graph to show Kate‚Äôs data.

SubTopics: Compare two fractions with the same numerator or denominator using the symbols >, = or <, and justify the solution.
Content: Monique has finished 3/4 of her math project and 3/8 of her reading project. Which statement correctly compares the fractions of the projects Monique has finished?

SubTopics: Solve problems involving addition and subtraction of minutes.
Content: The point on the number line shows that Malcolm started riding a train at 3:12 in the afternoon.
problems/MOG3M/media/9a.jpg
He finished riding the train at 4:10 in the afternoon. For how many minutes did Malcolm ride the train?

Topics: Number Sense & Operations In Base Ten
SubTopics: Demonstrate fluency with addition and subtraction within 1000.
Content: Andrea and Steven make copies of a worksheet. Andrea makes 225 copies of the worksheet. Steven makes 377 copies of the worksheet. How many total copies of the worksheet do they make?

SubTopics: Use multiplication and division within 100 to solve problems.
Content: Kyle has 45 watermelon seeds. He plants 9 rows of watermelons with the same number of seeds in each row. How many seeds does Kyle plant in each row?

SubTopics: Tell and write time to the nearest minute.
Content: Raj starts a game of chess at 1:55. Draw an hour hand and a minute hand on the clock face to show what time Raj starts his game of chess.
problems/MOG3M/media/12a.jpg

SubTopics: Describe the numerator as representing the number of pieces being considered.
Content: Percy plays on a soccer team. To show the fraction of soccer games in which he scored a goal, he makes the picture below.
problems/MOG3M/media/13a.jpg
Percy shades in part of his picture to show the fraction of soccer games in which he scored a goal. Then, he writes ‚ñ°/8 to represent this fraction. What numerator should Percy put in the box?

Topics: Number Sense & Operations In Base Ten
SubTopics: Multiply whole numbers by multiples of 10 in the range 10-90.
Content: Ms. Isama‚Äôs class set up 8 rows of chairs for a school assembly. Each row had 40 chairs. How many chairs did Ms. Isama‚Äôs class set up for the assembly?

SubTopics: Apply properties of operations as strategies to multiply and divide.
Content: Inez buys 5 boxes of granola bars. There are 8 bars in each box. Which expression is equivalent to the total number of granola bars?

SubTopics: Understand a fraction represents the endpoint of the length a given number of partitions from 0.
Content: A number line is shown.
problems/MOG3M/media/16a.jpg
What fraction does the location of A represent on the number line?

SubTopics: Multiply and divide with numbers and results within 100 using strategies such as the relationship between multiplication and division or properties of operations. Know all products of two one-digit numbers.
Content: Mariana is trying to find the value of 63 √∑ 9. Select the ùóßùó™ùó¢ expressions that could help her find the value of 63 √∑ 9.

SubTopics: Solve problems involving perimeters of polygons.
Content: Ricardo‚Äôs living room is shaped like a rectangle. The diagram represents his living room.
problems/MOG3M/media/18a.jpg
What is the perimeter, in feet, of Ricardo‚Äôs living room?

SubTopics: Understand a unit fraction as the quantity formed by one part when a whole is partitioned into equal parts.
Content: Emily makes 5 pizzas. She puts pepperoni on part of each pizza. The 5 pizzas are shown. The shaded part of each pizza shows the part that has pepperoni. Match each pizza with the fraction showing the part that has pepperoni. Draw a line to make a match.

SubTopics: Write and solve two-step problems involving variables using any of the four operations.
Content: Deborah needs to buy 36 cupcakes for a class party. She buys 4 containers that each have 6 cupcakes. She creates the equation shown to find out how many more cupcakes, c, she needs to buy.
How many more cupcakes does Deborah need to buy?

Topics: Number Sense & Operations In Base Ten
SubTopics: Round whole numbers to the nearest 10 or 100.
Content: The distance from Jay‚Äôs home to his aunt‚Äôs home is 1,845 kilometers. What is this distance, in kilometers, rounded to the nearest hundred?

SubTopics: Understand a fraction represents the endpoint of the length a given number of partitions from 0.
Content: Which number line shows w located at 1/4?

SubTopics: Write and solve two-step problems involving variables using any of the four operations.
Content: There are 3 bushes outside of Ms. Wilbourne‚Äôs classroom. Each bush has 10 flowers. Ms. Wilbourne picks all of the flowers and divides them equally among 6 teachers. How many flowers does each teacher receive?

SubTopics: Multiply whole-number side lengths to solve problems involving the area of rectangles.
Content: A diagram of Miss Alicia‚Äôs classroom is shown.
problems/MOG3M/media/24a.jpg
What is the area, in square meters, of Miss Alicia‚Äôs classroom?

SubTopics: Understand a unit fraction as the quantity formed by one part when a whole is partitioned into equal parts.
Content: The Khan family orders a pizza to share. The pizza is cut into 8 slices. Select the ùóßùó™ùó¢ options that show the part of the whole that is represented by 1 piece of the pizza.

SubTopics: Create a line plot to represent data.
Content: Maria asked 10 friends to name the capital cities of 10 different states. The list shows the number of capital cities each friend correctly named.
Make a dot plot to show the number of capital cities each friend correctly named.

SubTopics: Interpret products of whole numbers.
Content: Which expression shows another way to find 3 √ó 7?

Topics: Number Sense & Operations In Base Ten
SubTopics: Multiply whole numbers by multiples of 10 in the range 10-90.
Content: There are 6 third-grade classrooms at Washington Elementary. Each classroom has 30 desks. What is the total number of desks in the third-grade classrooms at Washington Elementary?

SubTopics: Understand that rectangles can have equal perimeters but different areas, or rectangles can have equal areas but different perimeters.
Content: Ian makes two rectangular flags.

:ibox:‚Ä¢ One flag has a length of 6 feet and a width of 4 feet.

‚Ä¢ The other flag has a length of 7 feet and a width of 3 feet.
Which statement about the two flags is correct?

A.Choice: The flags have the same perimeter and the same area.

B.Choice: The flags have the same perimeter but different areas.

C.Choice: The flags have the same area but different perimeters.

D.Choice: The flags have different areas and different perimeters.

Topics: Number Sense & Operations In Base Ten
SubTopics: Multiply whole numbers by multiples of 10 in the range 10-90.
Content: Arthur purchased a car for 10,565 dollars. Which expression represents the price of the car in expanded form?

Topics: Number Sense & Operations In Base Ten
SubTopics: Read, write and identify whole numbers within 100,000 using base ten numerals, number names and expanded form.
Content: In each of the two equal-sized circles below, the shaded part represents a fraction.
problems/MOG3M/media/31a.jpg
problems/MOG3M/media/31b.jpg
Which statement correctly explains why the shaded part of each circle must represent the same fraction?

A.Choice: Each circle has the same area shaded.

B.Choice: One circle has more shaded pieces than the other circle.

C.Choice: Each circle has some pieces shaded and some pieces not shaded.

D.Choice: The shaded pieces in one circle are smaller than the shaded pieces in the other circle.

SubTopics: Demonstrate that two fractions are equivalent if they are the same size, or the same point on a number line.
Content: Which expression could be used to represent 5 √ó 8?

SubTopics: Interpret the reasonableness of answers using mental computation and estimation strategies including rounding.
Content: Garrett collects rocks. He rounds the number of rocks he has to the nearest ten and says he has 40 rocks. For each number, mark whether it is possible or not possible as the number of rocks in Garrett‚Äôs collection.

Topics: Number Sense & Operations In Base Ten
SubTopics: Round whole numbers to the nearest 10 or 100.
Content: Several shapes are shown.
problems/MOG3M/media/34a.jpg
Select the ùóßùó™ùó¢ statements that are true about ALL of the shapes.

SubTopics: Understand that shapes in different categories may share attributes and that the shared attributes can define a larger category.
Content: To answer a question, Abel multiplies 2 √ó 6. Which question could Abel be answering?

A.Choice: Abel has 6 cats and 2 dogs. How many cats and dogs does Abel have?

B.Choice: Abel eats 2 of the 6 cherries in a fruit bowl. How many cherries are remaining in the fruit bowl?

C.Choice: Abel has 2 boxes of pencils. Each box contains 6 pencils. How many pencils does Abel have?

D.Choice: Abel bakes 6 muffins and shares them equally with 2 people. How many muffins does each person get?

SubTopics: Understand that when a whole is partitioned equally, a fraction can be used to represent a portion of the whole.
Content: At Ellen‚Äôs school, 5/6 of the students take the bus. At Ramon‚Äôs school, 4/6 of the students take the bus.

:ibox:Ellen says, ‚ÄúMore students take the bus at my school than at Ramon‚Äôs school.‚Äù

Ramon says, ‚ÄúMore students take the bus at my school than at Ellen‚Äôs school.‚Äù
Which piece of information is needed to determine who is correct?

B.Choice: the distance each school bus drives

C.Choice: the number of buses at each school

D.Choice: the number of students at each school

SubTopics: Interpret quotients of whole numbers.
Content: Which model represents the equation 56 √∑ 7 = m?

Topics: Number Sense & Operations In Base Ten
SubTopics: Demonstrate fluency with addition and subtraction within 1000.
Content: There are 318 students who attend Jefferson Elementary. There are 504 students who attend Riverside Elementary. How many more students attend Riverside Elementary than Jefferson Elementary?

SubTopics: Recognize and generate equivalent fractions using visual models, and justify why the fractions are equivalent.
Content: Trevon says that 2/8 of the circle shown is shaded.

What other fraction could Trevon use to describe the fraction of the circle that is shaded?

SubTopics: Identify arithmetic patterns and explain the patterns using properties of operations.
Content: Nolan opens 5 boxes of books for a book fair. Each box has the same number of books in it. Nolan puts all the books from each box on shelves. He makes a table to show how many books he has put on shelves for the first 4 boxes.
problems/MOG3M/media/40a.jpg
Use the words and numbers below the blank lines to describe the pattern to find the total number of books.
The total number of books Nolan will put on shelves is equal to the number of books in the first 4 boxes :DD-1: :DD-2: .
